schemes.name: PM-KISAN
schemes.description: Direct income support of ₹6,000 per year to all farmer families owning cultivable land.
benefits: No land size limit for eligibility
eligibility: Small and marginal farmer families
Landholding farmers across the country
Aadhaar card mandatory

schemes.name: MGNREGA
schemes.fullName: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act
schemes.description: Guarantees 100 days of wage employment per year to rural households.
benefits: Minimum wage rates as per state government
eligibility: Adult members of rural households
Willing to do manual unskilled work
Job card registration required

schemes.name: PMAY-G
schemes.description: Provides pucca houses with basic amenities to houseless and those living in kutcha houses in rural areas.
benefits: 90 sq. ft. minimum area with basic amenities
eligibility: Houseless families and those with kutcha houses
Families not owning a pucca house
Priority to SC/ST, minorities, and women-headed households

schemes.name: Ayushman Bharat
schemes.description: Largest health insurance scheme providing coverage up to ₹5 lakh per family per year.
benefits: ₹5 lakh coverage per family per year
Coverage for pre and post hospitalization
eligibility: Families identified in SECC-2011 database
Rural families with specific deprivation criteria
Urban families in occupational categories

schemes.name: PM Fasal Bima Yojana
schemes.description: Crop insurance scheme providing financial support to farmers in case of crop failure.
benefits: Low premium rates: 2% for Kharif, 1.5% for Rabi
Coverage for natural calamities, pests & diseases
eligibility: All farmers growing notified crops
Both loanee and non-loanee farmers eligible
Tenant farmers with proper documentation

schemes.name: MUDRA Yojana
schemes.description: Provides loans up to ₹10 lakh to micro enterprises and small businesses.
eligibility: Non-corporate, non-farm enterprises
Manufacturing, trading, or service activities
Income generating activities

schemes.name: Swachh Bharat Mission
schemes.description: Aims to achieve universal sanitation coverage in rural areas through toilet construction.
eligibility: Households without access to toilets
Rural households below poverty line get priority
Community participation essential

schemes.name: Ujjwala Yojana
schemes.description: Provides free LPG connections to women from BPL households.
benefits: EMI facility for stove and refill
eligibility: Women aged 18 and above from BPL families
Must not have LPG connection in household
Priority to SC/ST, PMAY, AAY families

schemes.name: PM-FPO
schemes.fullName: Pradhan Mantri Formalization of Micro Food Processing Enterprises
schemes.description: Support to Farmer Producer Organizations for better market access and value addition.
benefits: ₹15 lakh grant for FPOs in plains
₹33 lakh grant for FPOs in NE/Hills
eligibility: Registered Farmer Producer Organizations
Minimum 300 farmers for plains, 100 for hills
Focus on value chain development

schemes.name: PM-SYM
schemes.description: Voluntary pension scheme for unorganized sector workers aged 18-40 years.
benefits: Assured monthly pension of ₹3,000 after 60 years
Family pension in case of death during contribution
Government co-contribution equal to worker's contribution
eligibility: Unorganized sector workers aged 18-40
Monthly income up to ₹15,000
Not covered under EPF/ESIC/NPS

schemes.name: Jal Jeevan Mission
schemes.fullName: Jal Jeevan Mission - Har Ghar Jal
schemes.description: Provides functional household tap connections to every rural household by 2024.
benefits: Assured water supply of 55 litres per person per day
Functional tap connection to every household
Community participation in planning and implementation
eligibility: All rural households in the country
Priority to water-stressed and drought-prone areas
Community ownership and operation

schemes.name: Samagra Shiksha
schemes.description: Integrated scheme for school education from pre-school to class XII.
eligibility: All children aged 6-14 years
Government and government-aided schools
Focus on girl child education

schemes.name: Kisan Credit Card
schemes.description: Provides timely credit support for comprehensive credit needs of farmers.
benefits: Credit limit based on cropping pattern and scale of finance
eligibility: All farmers - individual/joint borrowers
Tenant farmers, oral lessees, sharecroppers
Self Help Group members engaged in farming

schemes.name: PMGSY
schemes.description: Provides connectivity to unconnected habitations in rural areas through good all-weather roads.
benefits: Integration with other rural development programs
eligibility: Habitations with population 500+ (250+ in tribal/desert areas)
Unconnected habitations identified in core network
Focus on remote and backward areas

schemes.name: Stand Up India
schemes.description: Facilitates bank loans between ₹10 lakh to ₹1 crore for SC/ST and women entrepreneurs.
benefits: Bank loans from ₹10 lakh to ₹1 crore
Preferential lending to women and marginalized communities
eligibility: SC/ST and/or women entrepreneurs aged 18 years and above
Greenfield enterprises in manufacturing, services or trading
Borrower should not be in default to any bank

schemes.name: Digital India Land Records
schemes.description: Modernization of land records through digitization and online access.
eligibility: All landowners in participating states
Revenue villages covered under the program
Digital literacy helpful but not mandatory

schemes.name: Forest Rights Act
schemes.fullName: Scheduled Tribes and Other Traditional Forest Dwellers Act
schemes.description: Recognition of forest rights of forest dwelling Scheduled Tribes and other traditional forest dwellers.
benefits: Individual and community forest rights recognition
Right to forest produce collection and sale
eligibility: Scheduled Tribes and other traditional forest dwellers
Primarily residing in forests for livelihood
Dependent on forest for bona fide needs

schemes.name: Van Dhan Yojana
schemes.description: Skill upgradation and capacity building program for tribal gatherers of Minor Forest Produce.
eligibility: Tribal gatherers and forest dwellers
Self Help Groups in tribal areas
Focus on Minor Forest Produce value chain

schemes.name: Eklavya Model Schools
schemes.description: Quality education to tribal students in their medium of instruction with focus on preserving local art and culture.
benefits: Education in local language and culture
eligibility: Tribal children in areas with 50%+ tribal population
Focus on aspirational and tribal districts
Preference to children from remote areas

schemes.name: Jan Aushadhi
schemes.description: Provides quality generic medicines at affordable prices through Jan Aushadhi stores.
benefits: Wide network of Jan Aushadhi stores
eligibility: All citizens can purchase from Jan Aushadhi stores
No specific eligibility criteria
Prescription required for scheduled medicines
